rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective directly modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment reports culling numbers and reason factually without using high-potency verbs or potent metaphors.
'will be killed' is a containment verb (future tense), neutral even with numbers.
The segment does not contain a loaded rhetorical question.
The segment reports negative facts/action taken (birds killed) but contains no explicit calming cue.
The segment does not contain a minimiser used in conjunction with a scale contrast.
The segment does not contain a bare negation.
Describes action to be taken ('will be killed in order to prevent the virus from spreading') without active reassurance.
